Questions.QuestionString: 16. What colour is used to indicate a tertiary structure on a diagram or drawing?. (Level 2)

B. Highly stressed parts and if damaged may cause failure of the aircraft and loss of life.
C. Lightly stressed parts such as fairings, wheel shields and minor component brackets etc.

Questions.QuestionString:

Questions.QuestionString:

B. use a ATC600 test set.
C. use the output on the flight deck.

Questions.QuestionString: 196. Bonding lead testers are attached with. (Level 2)
Answers:
A. a 60 feet lead is connected to the main earth and a 6 foot test lead is connected to check the
resistance between selected points.

B. a 6 feet test lead is connected to the main earth and a 60 feet lead is connected to check the
resistance between selected points.
C. either of the leads can be connected anywhere.

Questions.QuestionString: 197. On a Bonding Tester the number of probes on the 60 ft and 6ft leads respectively are. (Level 2)
198. The damping force in a meter. (Level 2)
Answers: A. prevents oscillation of the pointer.
B. returns the pointer to zero.
C. assists the pointer to move over the scale.

Questions.QuestionString: 199. On a VOR/ILS test set the 'Tone Delete' function. (Level 2)
Answers: A. functionally checks that the glideslope pointer moves down-scale.
B. functionally checks that the glideslope failure flag operates.
C. functionally checks that the glideslope pointer moves up-scale.

Questions.QuestionString: 200. What is third angle projection?. (Level 1)
Answers: A. each view represents the side of the object furthest from the adjacent view.
B. each view represents the side of the object nearest to it in the adjacent view.
C. each view is at an angle of 30 degrees to the plane of projection.

201.
This drawing indicates. (Level 1)
202. The width of a visible outline on a drawing is. (Level 1)
203. What does GA stand for on a drawing?. (Level 1)
204. Design drawings of aircraft components are produced by organizations approved by. (Level 1)
Answers: C. CAA in accordance with the BCARs.
